page.title: 07A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A P.C.
page.content: {P.C. ALLEN}HAS BEEN IN THE GLOS. POLICE FORCE FOR 12 YEARS. HE WAS TRANSFERRED FROM CHELTENHAM TO W_U_E ON 19TH APRIL 1985. WHEN HE GOES ON DUTY THE FIRST THING HE DOES IS CHECK THE ANSWERPHONE AND THE TELEX MACHINE; THEN THE MISC. COMPLAINTS BOOK, THE GLOS. CRIME BOOK AND THE CRIME (OTHER FORCES) BOOK. HE THEN FOLLOWS UP ANY QUERIES FROM THIS INFORMATION. HE HAS A REGULAR BEAT AND HAS THE USE OF A CAR AND MOTORCYCLE. ONE OF HIS DAILY TASKS IS TO KEEP TRAFFIC FLOWING IN { {LONG ST.}HE REGULARLY DEALS WITH MINOR BUMPS BETWEEN CARS, LOST PROPERTY, VANDALISM AND SHOPLIFTING. HE IS PROUD OF HIS{UNIFORM}AND THINKS KEEPING FIT IS VERY IMPORTANT. P.C. ALLEN JOINED THE POLICE FORCE BECAUSE HE WANTED TO CONTINUE THE OUTDOOR LIFE AFTER BEING IN THE MERCHANT NAVY. HE THINKS THE PEOPLE OF W_U_E ARE VERY FRIENDLY.
